page.title: 05Harewood Forest Lparish
page.content: 04400144 {Harewood Forest is the second largest {ancient woodland in Hants}.In our D-Block it covers 650-700 hectares and is owned privately by one person.The soil is clay with flints over chalk.The predominant species is oak, with birch and some conifers.From the 13th Century the forest has been { {coppiced with standards.}This century the demand for coppice wood has decreased and from the 1960's a new policy has been followed.{Clearances } totalling 145 acres have been made and {planted with conifers. Since 1982 }the clearing of{10 acres}at a time has been introduced and the planting of { {sessile oak,beech}and{ash}undertaken.
